2 cups red lentils ADVERTISEMENT 1 large onion, diced ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons curry paste ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon curry powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground turmeric ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon chili powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon minced garlic ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14.25 ounce) can tomato puree ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 30 m Ready In 40 m Wash the lentils in cold water until the water runs clear. Put lentils in a pot with enough water to cover; bring to a boil, place a cover on the pot, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, adding water during cooking as needed to keep covered, until tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Drain. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onions in hot oil until caramelized, about 20 minutes. Mix curry paste, curry powder, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, salt, sugar, garlic, and ginger together in a large bowl; stir into the onions. Increase heat to high and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the tomato puree, remove from heat and stir into the lentils.

1 cup yogurt ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon lemon juice ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons cayenne pepper ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger ADVERTISEMENT 4 teaspoons salt, or to taste ADVERTISEMENT 3 boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces ADVERTISEMENT 4 long skewers ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon butter ADVERTISEMENT 1 clove garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 jalapeno pepper, finely chopped ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons paprika ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon salt, or to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup heavy cream ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 30 m Cook 50 m Ready In 2 h 20 m In a large bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, 2 teaspoons cumin, cinnamon, cayenne, black pepper, ginger, and 4 teaspoons salt. Stir in chicken, cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour. Preheat a grill for high heat. Lightly oil the grill grate. Thread chicken onto skewers, and discard marinade. Grill until juices run clear, about 5 minutes on each side. Melt butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Saute garlic and jalapeno for 1 minute. Season with 2 teaspoons cumin, paprika, and 3 teaspoons salt. Stir in tomato sauce and cream. Simmer on low heat until sauce thickens, about 20 minutes. Add grilled chicken, and simmer for 10 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter, and garnish with fresh cilantro.

1 1/2 pounds fresh broccoli, cut into bite size pieces ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup butter ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons white vinegar ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 2 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup chopped salted cashews ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 10 m Ready In 20 m Place the broccoli into a large pot with about 1 inch of water in the bottom. Bring to a boil, and cook for 7 minutes, or until tender but still crisp. Drain, and arrange broccoli on a serving platter. While the broccoli is cooking, melt the butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Mix in the brown sugar, soy sauce, vinegar, pepper and garlic. Bring to a boil, then remove from the heat. Mix in the cashews, and pour the sauce over the broccoli. Serve immediately.

1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into chunks ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons white wine ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons sesame oil, divided ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons cornstarch, dissolved in 2 tablespoons water ADVERTISEMENT 1 ounce hot chile paste ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon distilled white vinegar ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 4 green onions, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon chopped garlic ADVERTISEMENT 1 (8 ounce) can water chestnuts ADVERTISEMENT 4 ounces chopped peanuts ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 30 m Cook 30 m Ready In 1 h 30 m To Make Marinade: Combine 1 tablespoon wine, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon oil and 1 tablespoon cornstarch/water mixture and mix together. Place chicken pieces in a glass dish or bowl and add marinade. Toss to coat. Cover dish and place in refrigerator for about 30 minutes. To Make Sauce: In a small bowl combine 1 tablespoon wine, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon oil, 1 tablespoon cornstarch/water mixture, chili paste, vinegar and sugar. Mix together and add green onion, garlic, water chestnuts and peanuts. In a medium skillet, heat sauce slowly until aromatic. Meanwhile, remove chicken from marinade and saute in a large skillet until meat is white and juices run clear. When sauce is aromatic, add sauteed chicken to it and let simmer together until sauce thickens.

Prep 20 m Cook 15 m Ready In 35 m Bring a pan of water to a boil, and cook the ramen until tender, about 3 minutes. Plunge the noodles into cold water to stop the cooking, drain in a colander set in the sink, and drizzle the noodles with 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Set aside. Place the chicken strips in a bowl, and toss with olive oil, garlic salt, and black pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a wok over high heat, and cook and stir the chicken until it is no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Stir in the shallots and garlic, and cook and stir until they start to turn brown. Add the cabbage, carrots, broccoli, and mushrooms, and cook and stir until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in the ramen noodles, soy sauce, sweet soy sauce, and oyster sauce, mixing the noodles and sauces into the vegetables and chicken. Bring the mixture to a simmer, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and serve hot.

Prep 40 m Cook 40 m Ready In 3 h 20 m Pour 1 1/2 cups water, orange juice, lemon juice, rice vinegar, and soy sauce into a saucepan and set over medium-high heat. Stir in the orange zest, brown sugar, ginger, garlic, chopped onion, and red pepper flakes. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat, and cool 10 to 15 minutes. Place the chicken pieces into a resealable plastic bag. When contents of saucepan have cooled, pour 1 cup of sauce into bag. Reserve the remaining sauce. Seal the bag, and refrigerate at least 2 hours. In another resealable plastic bag, mix the flour, salt, and pepper. Add the marinated chicken pieces, seal the bag, and shake to coat. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place chicken into the skillet, and brown on both sides. Drain on a plate lined with paper towels, and cover with aluminum foil. Wipe out the skillet, and add the sauce. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Mix together the cornstarch and 2 tablespoons water; stir into the sauce. Reduce heat to medium low, add the chicken pieces, and simmer, about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Prep 30 m Cook 7 m Ready In 3 h In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Let stand about 10 minutes, until frothy. Stir in sugar, milk, egg, salt, and enough flour to make a soft dough. Knead for 6 to 8 minutes on a lightly floured surface, or until smooth. Place dough in a well oiled bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and set aside to rise. Let it rise 1 hour, until the dough has doubled in volume. Punch down dough, and knead in garlic. Pinch off small handfuls of dough about the size of a golf ball. Roll into balls, and place on a tray. Cover with a towel, and allow to rise until doubled in size, about 30 minutes. During the second rising, preheat grill to high heat. At grill side, roll one ball of dough out into a thin circle. Lightly oil grill. Place dough on grill, and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, or until puffy and lightly browned. Brush uncooked side with butter, and turn over. Brush cooked side with butter, and cook until browned, another 2 to 4 minutes. Remove from grill, and continue the process until all the naan has been prepared.

4 tablespoons vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 4 small potatoes, peeled and halved ADVERTISEMENT 2 large onions, finely chopped ADVERTISEMENT 2 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon chili powder ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 2 medium tomatoes, peeled and chopped ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons plain yogurt ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint leaves ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom ADVERTISEMENT 1 (2 inch) piece cinnamon stick ADVERTISEMENT 3 pounds boneless, skinless chicken pieces cut into chunks ADVERTISEMENT 2 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 large onion, diced ADVERTISEMENT 1 pinch powdered saffron ADVERTISEMENT 5 pods cardamom ADVERTISEMENT 3 whole cloves ADVERTISEMENT 1 (1 inch) piece cinnamon stick ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger ADVERTISEMENT 1 pound basmati rice ADVERTISEMENT 4 cups chicken stock ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 teaspoons salt ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

In a large skillet, in 2 tablespoons vegetable oil (or ghee) fry potatoes until brown, drain and reserve the potatoes. Add remaining 2 tablespoons oil to the skillet and fry onion, garlic and ginger until onion is soft and golden. Add chili, pepper, turmeric, cumin, salt and the tomatoes. Fry, stirring constantly for 5 minutes. Add yogurt, mint, cardamom and cinnamon stick. Cover and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally until the tomatoes are cooked to a pulp. It may be necessary to add a little hot water if the mixture becomes too dry and starts to stick to the pan. When the mixture is thick and smooth, add the chicken pieces and stir well to coat them with the spice mixture. Cover and cook over very low heat until the chicken is tender, approximately 35 to 45 minutes. There should only be a little very thick gravy left when chicken is finished cooking. If necessary cook uncovered for a few minutes to reduce the gravy. Wash rice well and drain in colander for at least 30 minutes. In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil (or ghee) and fry the onions until they are golden. Add saffron, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon stick, ginger and rice. Stir continuously until the rice is coated with the spices. In a medium-size pot, heat the chicken stock and salt. When the mixture is hot pour it over the rice and stir well. Add the chicken mixture and the potatoes; gently mix them into the rice. Bring to boil. Cover the saucepan tightly, turn heat to very low and steam for 20 minutes. Do not lift lid or stir while cooking. Spoon biryani onto a warm serving dish.

Prep 30 m Cook 20 m Ready In 1 h In a saucepan, combine 1 1/2 cups water, sugar, vinegar, reserved pineapple juice, and orange food coloring. Heat to boiling. Turn off heat. Combine 1/4 cup cornstarch and 1/4 cup water; slowly stir into saucepan. Continue stirring until mixture thickens. Combine flour, 2 tablespoons oil, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, salt, white pepper, and egg. Add 1 1/2 cups water gradually to make a thick batter. Stir to blend thoroughly. Add chicken pieces, and stir until chicken is well coated. Heat oil in skillet or wok to 360 degrees F (180 degrees C). Fry chicken pieces in hot oil 10 minutes, or until golden. Remove chicken, and drain on paper towels. When ready to serve, layer green peppers, pineapple chunks, and cooked chicken pieces on a platter. Pour hot sweet and sour sauce over top.

1/3 cup warm water ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup packed brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons orange juice ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons ketchup ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon white vinegar ADVERTISEMENT 4 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon grated orange peel ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons olive oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cubed ADVERTISEMENT 2 cups water ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup uncooked white rice ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons cornstarch ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons cold water ADVERTISEMENT chopped green onions for garnish ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 45 m Ready In 1 h In a bowl, stir together warm water, brown sugar, orange juice, soy sauce, ketchup, white vinegar, garlic, red pepper flakes, five-spice powder, and orange peel until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is well combined. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat, and cook and stir the chicken until the outside is golden brown and the inside is no longer pink, 10 to 12 minutes. Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken, bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cover the skillet. Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. While the chicken and sauce are simmering, bring the rice and water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender, and the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes. Set the rice aside and keep warm. Whisk the cornstarch and 2 tablespoons of cold water in a small bowl until smooth, and stir into the chicken and sauce, a few teaspoons at a time. Let the chicken and sauce cook for about 2 minutes to thicken, then serve over hot cooked rice, sprinkled with green onion.

1 cup soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup water ADVERTISEMENT 4 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 onion, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger root ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon dried oregano ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes (optional) ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper (optional) ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground paprika (optional) ADVERTISEMENT 5 pounds skinless chicken thighs ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Cook 30 m Ready In 1 h 30 m Whisk together the soy sauce, brown sugar, water, garlic, onion, ginger, black pepper, oregano, red pepper flakes, cayenne pepper, and paprika in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Add the chicken thighs, and toss to evenly coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and marinate the chicken in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat, and lightly oil the grate. Remove the chicken thighs from the marinade. Discard the remaining marinade. Grill the chicken thighs on the preheated grill until cooked through, about 15 minutes per side.

Prep 10 m Cook 10 m Ready In 20 m Season the chicken breasts on both sides with salt and pepper. Place the flour, egg and panko crumbs into separate shallow dishes. Coat the chicken breasts in flour, shaking off any excess. Dip them into the egg, and then press into the panko crumbs until well coated on both sides.
